poem:
A Green Horizon Unfurled  

Pledged oaths held aloft,  
Great Britain curves  
towards the green,  
a labor of light.  
  
Paths diverge—  
tides of wind,  
currents of sun,  
harbored within  
is a quiet power,  
gentle as a new leaf.  
  
By 2030's sunlit dawn,  
the industry hums—  
bright,  
           bold,  
                     reborn.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "What will the UK’s plan for clean energy by 2030 mean for the industry and public? The Labour government came to power with a bold agenda to create a clean electricity system by 2030 to help make Great Britain a green energy superpower. This week its vision has found a route towards becoming a reality via an independent report from the National Energy System Operator (Neso). The system operator’s twin pathways may help to assuage". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
